metadata.dc:author: Orden-Martínez, Beatriz
Muñoz-Algarra, María
Martínez-Ruiz, Rocío
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVE To evaluate the Sysmex UF-1000i system as a urine screening method for the diagnosis of urinary tract infection, and epithelial cells as a predictive value of contamination in woman of childbearing age. METHODS A total of 1730 urine samples were processed using a urine culture as a reference. RESULTS With 50 bacteria/μl as a cut-off point, the results were: sensitivity 91.3%, specificity 73.1%, negative predictive value 96.2%. For a specificity of 90% for epithelial cells, the results were: sensitivity 31.0%, positive predictive value 67.0%, negative predictive value 66.0%. CONCLUSION The evaluated system is fast and effective. Epithelial cells could be used to predict contamination.
metadata.dc:title: Evaluación del sistema automatizado UF-1000i en el diagnóstico de infección urinaria.
[Evaluation of the Sysmex UF-1000i automated system for the diagnosis of urinary tract infection].
